name: James George
bio: I'm specialized in the JavaScript stack but still I have an immense love for python as well. I had experiemented with it while building stuffs like web apps, Desktop apps, 2-D games, and even messing up with ML and Data science topics. In the process I had come across a variety of libraries and had fun using them.

name: Jon Calder
bio: I've got limited experience with Python, but have found it fun and useful to learn, especially as a data scientist. I hope to continue learning from others and to be able to assist them on their journey.

name: Jesús Gómez
bio: For years, Python is my default language of choice when solving computing problems in general. I'm a member of Python Venezuela.

name: Jeff Parker
bio: I enjoy the simplicity of Python.

name: John Crickett
bio: Software Engineer who works mostly in C++ and Python, with an interest in AI, machine learning and data science/engineering

name: John Turner
bio: I've been working, either professionally or on side projects, with Python for about 3 years now. I love its versatility, easy syntax, and powerful capabilities. I'm excited to share what I've learned, and learn from others as well!

name: Joao Machado
bio: Everyday Python keeps surprising me with the simple! I work professionally with python and I do some side projects as well and I want to share my knowledge with the world! And learn in the way!

name: James Haney
bio: I'm a data scientist who's been using Python at work for 3-4 years. I love how readable and versatile it is.

name: Jason Peacock
bio: A software engineer of 20yrs, I've written production code in Perl, Ruby, and Python, among other languages. Python is my favorite interpreted language.

name: João Luiz
bio: I'm a CS student, Developer, that loves to use Python to solve problems and build things. I like helping others enhance their quality of life through knowledge sharing like programming skills, automation, and business stuff.
